title: Which software is mostly used for interior designers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which software is mostly used for interior designers? Revit is the industry standard for architecture, although there are some competing BIM programs out there. AutoCAD is still the standard for the disciplines that will support your work—subcontractors like plumbers and landscape architects may send .dwg files that you’ll have to import into your project. If you’re a student, you should focus on your hand drafting skills, followed by AutoCAD. Revit is extremely intuitive and easy to learn. If you don’t form a foundation in what you are doing, it won’t be much use to have advanced skills in how to do it.

Honestly there are so many types out there it's hard to say. It depends on what the designer specializes in & how big their business is. Program's are costly so I use the bare minimum to get by & do a lot of hand drawings because I'm a smaller business. Which ones are you curious about? I've probably heard of a few of them.
